      • round

        public static long round(long value,
                         long precision)
        Round the given value to the nearest multiple of precision. 
            Numbr.round(17387, 0)    =     0
    Numbr.round(17387, 1)    = 17387
    Numbr.round(17387, 2)    = 17388
    Numbr.round(17387, 10)   = 17390
    Numbr.round(17387, 100)  = 17400
    Numbr.round(17387, 500)  = 17500
    Numbr.round(17387, 1000) = 17000
    Numbr.round(-1689, 10)   = -1690
        Since:
        1.0

      • round

        public static double round(double value,
                           double precision)
        Round the given value to the nearest multiple of precision. 
            Numbr.round(58.915, 0.0001) =  58.915
    Numbr.round(58.915, 0.001)  =  58.915
    Numbr.round(58.915, 0.01)   =  58.92
    Numbr.round(58.915, 0.1)    =  58.9
    Numbr.round(58.915, 1.0)    =  59.0
    Numbr.round(58.915, 10.0)   =  60.0
    Numbr.round(58.915, 100.0)  = 100.0
    Numbr.round(58.915, 1000.0) =   0.0
    Numbr.round(-58.915, 0.01)  = -58.92
    Numbr.round(-58.915, 1.0)  =  -59.0
        Since:
        1.0

      • grabByte

        public static byte grabByte(int input,
                            int byteIndex)
        Return a single byte from the int input value.

        Bytes are numbered from 0 to 3, with 0 being the least-significant byte and 3 being the most-significant byte. 

            Numbr.grabByte(0x11223344, 0) = 0x44
    Numbr.grabByte(0x11223344, 1) = 0x33
    Numbr.grabByte(0x11223344, 2) = 0x22
    Numbr.grabByte(0x11223344, 3) = 0x11
        Parameters:
        input - the source of the byte
        byteIndex - the particular byte to retrieve: an integer between 0 (lsb) and 7 (msb)
        Returns:
        the desired byte
        Since:
        1.0

      • grabByte

        public static byte grabByte(long input,
                            int byteIndex)
        Return a single byte from the long input value.

        Bytes are numbered from 0 to 7, with 0 being the least-significant byte and 7 being the most-significant byte. 

            Numbr.grabByte(0x1122334455667788, 0) = 0x88
    Numbr.grabByte(0x1122334455667788, 1) = 0x77
    Numbr.grabByte(0x1122334455667788, 2) = 0x66
    Numbr.grabByte(0x1122334455667788, 3) = 0x55
    Numbr.grabByte(0x1122334455667788, 4) = 0x44
    Numbr.grabByte(0x1122334455667788, 5) = 0x33
    Numbr.grabByte(0x1122334455667788, 6) = 0x22
    Numbr.grabByte(0x1122334455667788, 7) = 0x11
        Parameters:
        input - the source of the byte
        byteIndex - the particular byte to retrieve: an integer between 0 (lsb) and 7 (msb)
        Returns:
        the desired byte
        Since:
        1.0

      • maxItem

        public static int maxItem(double... values)
        Return the index number (zero-based) in the list of values of the one that's the maximum. 
            Numbr.maxItem(1.2, 3.4, 7.8, 5.6) = 2
        Since:
        1.0
